Azt szeretném kérdezni, hogy miképpen lehet ehhez a listához file-okat hozzáadni - pl. "*.torrent" file-okat.

Köszönöm!

title: Firefox rotates text for 90 degrees in print preview
content:
Hello guys,

I'm experiencing this weird problem since yesterday. Normally, when I want to print a ticket, first it opens in a pdf viewer (it's an .aspx file), I check and confirm that the document displays properly and when I click print button, the same document still displays the same way and it prints normally, everything works fine. Since yesterday, I get my text rotated in printer preview and it gets printed rotated 90 degrees counter-clockwise. Everything in printer settings is double-checked and hasn't been changed in a while now. It happens in every computer I start my web-app (it doesn't matter which printer is attached). There are pictures bellow: 1. pdf preview (as it should be) and 2. rotated document when I press print button. Is this a bug, can this be fixed somehow, it's super important to me?

App is used only in Firefox, correct orientation is Portrait.

Thank you!
creator: ana235

title: Firefox not properly formatting brave search page
content:
Firefox is not properly displaying text on brave search results. When this page is displayed in chromium based browsers, text is much thicker and has some fragments in bold. Firefox has thin text and no bold fragments. Text is so thin it is barely visible. Problem only happens on win 8.1. On win 10 page displays normally. I compared win 8.1 firefox fonts settings to pc with win 10 and they are the same so page should be displayed similarly.

This is page on firefox on win 8.1 https://i.postimg.cc/Gt4k0DF6/1.png

This is page on win 10 or on win 8.1 in chromium browsers. https://i.postimg.cc/1XbDyzMX/2.png
creator: Piterk

title: Firefox doesn't save or autofill credit card
content:
Firefox doesn't save or auto fill credit card details. It is really annoying and I am considering changing back to chrome because of it. I've tried all the remedies I found to solve this. If I go to Settings>Privacy and Security, there is no block that says "Auto fill forms" or anything like that, where supposedly I could enable this. I also went to about:config, and made sure `extensions.formautofill.creditCards.available` and `extensions.formautofill.creditCards.enabled` are `true`. See below for full specification of anything with "credit" in about:config, and below that, anything with "formautofill". I'm using firefox 99.0

dom.payments.defaults.saveCreditCard true extensions.formautofill.creditCards.available true extensions.formautofill.creditCards.enabled true extensions.formautofill.creditCards.hideui false extensions.formautofill.creditCards.supported true extensions.formautofill.creditCards.supportedCountries US,CA,UK,FR,DE,NL extensions.formautofill.creditCards.used 1 services.sync.creditcards.lastSync 1649923224.14 services.sync.creditcards.syncID U8PL3v5_czDA services.sync.engine.creditcards true services.sync.engine.creditcards.available true


dom.forms.autocomplete.formautofill true extensions.formautofill.addresses.capture.enabled false extensions.formautofill.addresses.enabled true extensions.formautofill.addresses.supported detect extensions.formautofill.addresses.supportedCountries US,CA,UK extensions.formautofill.available on extensions.formautofill.creditCards.available true extensions.formautofill.creditCards.enabled true extensions.formautofill.creditCards.hideui false extensions.formautofill.creditCards.supported true extensions.formautofill.creditCards.supportedCountries US,CA,UK,FR,DE,NL extensions.formautofill.creditCards.used 1 extensions.formautofill.firstTimeUse true extensions.formautofill.heuristics.enabled true extensions.formautofill.loglevel Warn extensions.formautofill.reauth.enabled true extensions.formautofill.section.enabled true extensions.formautofill.supportRTL true


I have firefox synched between my Macbook (MacOS Monterey) and Android phone. Previous details are from the macbook. On android, I could manually add a credit card to firefox. I also have synch of credit cards turned on. Still neither on my phone nor my macbook do I get creditcard autofill working.
creator: matsvanes

title: Sync and Tool Bookmarks
content: Desde hace un una semana Firefox no se conecta a mi cuenta de Sync ni a ninguna otra. Al momento de intentar logearme se queda en bucle. Cuando borro la carpeta de Mozila en %appdata% empieza a funcionar con normalidad, sin embargo al cerrar la aplicación y volverla a abrir se vuelve a bugear. Cuando ingreso al apartado de configuaración>sync, Firefox se queda congelado en "Sincronizando" y nunca termina de sincronizar, esto solo pasa en este ordanador y en ningun otro me ha pasado algo parecido, ya probe desintalar el programa e incluso formatear Windows pero no ha servido de nada. Las funcionalidades de autorelleno de contraseñas y abrir ventanas en otro ordenardor siguen funcionando con normalidad, pero las bookmarks dejan de aparecer en la barra, aparece vacio como si no hubiese nada.
creator: applediegoaif

title: Firefox bug and Microsoft Outlook web site: Firefox will not allow Windows computer to sleep
content:
After a new email notification sound plays from Microsoft Outlook, https://outlook.office.com/mail/, Firefox has a constant audio stream in use, preventing Windows computers from sleeping.

How to reproduce: 1) In an Admin Command Prompt, execute "powercfg /requests" and verify nothing has a power request, especially "SYSTEM: None." 2) In Firefox, open a tab and login into a Microsoft Outlook account at https://outlook.office.com/mail/. 3) Wait for a new email which triggers an audible chime. 4) In the Admin Command Prompt, verify "powercfg /requests" reports "SYSTEM: [DRIVER] <audio-driver-specific-string> An audio stream is currently in use." Note the computer will never go to sleep due to this request. 5) Close the Firefox tab with Microsoft Outlook. 6) In the Admin Command Prompt, verify "powercfg /requests" has no power requests, especially "SYSTEM: None". Note the computer will sleep after the idle period as expected.
creator: .Brian

title: New page on Newegg ALWAYS jumps to bottom--ANNOYING !!!!
content:
When on Newegg.com a New page on ALWAYS jumps to bottom--ANNOYING !! This action happens EVERY time !! It's because, at the bottom of EVERY page there is an entry to enter my email address for advertising -- and Firefox AUTOMATICALLY jumps down to the bottom of that page FORCING ATTENTION to make me enter my email address which I have done many times !!!

BUT, on the suggestion from Newegg, I tried Chrome (browser) and went to Newegg and clicked around many new pages and this problem (of the focus and page dropping down to the MORE .. Enter Email Address [near the bottom]) did NOT happen --- This problem only happens EVERY TIME on Firefox ver 99.0.1 64-bit !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! 

Guys, Really, This is ANNOYING.  Believe me.

P.S. This problem happens on both my laptops, a $3,000 ASUS and a $2,800 Gigabyte when on a Newegg webpage.
